t: In the Shadow of Your Wings
Hear*pn a just cause, O Lord;*s attend to my cry! Give*ld ear to my prayer from lips free of deceit!
From*ln your presence let my vindication come! Let*ld your eyes behold the right!
You*pn have tried my heart, you have visited me by night, you*ld have tested me, and you will find nothing; I*ld have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
With*ln regard to the works of man, by the word of your lips I*ld have avoided the ways of the violent.
My*ln steps have held fast to your paths; my*ld feet have not slipped.
I*pn call upon you, for you will answer me, O God; incline*ld your ear to me; hear my words.
Wondrously*ln show your steadfast love, O*ld Savior of those who seek refuge from*ld their adversaries at your right hand.
Keep*pn me as the apple of your eye; hide*ld me in the shadow of your wings,
from*ln the wicked who do me violence, my*ld deadly enemies who surround me.
They*pn close their hearts to pity; with*ld their mouths they speak arrogantly.
They*ln have now surrounded our steps; they*ld set their eyes to cast us to the ground.
He*ln is like a lion eager to tear, as*ld a young lion lurking in ambush.
Arise,*pn O Lord!*s Confront him, subdue him! Deliver*ld my soul from the wicked by your sword,

from*ln men by your hand, O Lord,*s from*ld men of the world whose portion is in this life. You*ln fill their womb with treasure; they*ld are satisfied with children, and*ld they leave their abundance to their infants.
As*pn for me, I shall behold your face in righteousness; when*ld I awake, I shall be satisfied with your likeness.
